metadata.title: RHSA-2009:0046 -- ntp security update (Moderate)
metadata.description: Updated ntp packages to correct a security issue are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4 and 5. This update has been rated as having moderate security impact by the Red Hat Security Response Team. The Network Time Protocol (NTP) is used to synchronize a computer's time with a referenced time source. A flaw was discovered in the way the ntpd daemon checked the return value of the OpenSSL EVP_VerifyFinal function. On systems using NTPv4 authentication, this could lead to an incorrect verification of cryptographic signatures, allowing time-spoofing attacks. (CVE-2009-0021)
